topItems.title: Machine Learning in Power BI

value.title: Using Power BI gateways to connect to data sources
value.excerpt: Learn all about the On-Premises Data Gateway and how it is used with the Power BI service. The Power BI gateway can be used to refresh imported data as well as allow you to use DirectQuery or connect live to an Analysis Services mode.

topItems.title: Get started with the Power BI Gateway
topItems.excerpt: Get to know what the Power BI Gateway is along with how to get it setup for scheduled refresh of imported data.  Free Gateway Cube Sheet: https://guyinacu.be/gatewaystartpdf  Gateway Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-onprem  Gateway sizing: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/gateway-onprem-sizing

topItems.title: What the HECK is a Power BI Gateway Cluster?
topItems.excerpt: Confused about what a Power BI Gateway cluster is? Have your On-Premises Data Gateway installed but it's overloaded? This video is for you!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/data-integration/gateway/service-gateway-high-availability-clusters  PowerShell: https://docs.microsoft.com/data-integration/gateway/service-gateway-powershell-support

topItems.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio

value.title: Analyze data with Power BI
value.excerpt: This module goes beyond viewing and exploring your content and explains how to interact with it by working with reports and dashboards to uncover and share new business insights.

value.title: Publish and share in Power BI
value.excerpt: Publish and share your Power BI reports and dashboards to teammates in your organization or to everyone on the web.

value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values.  In order to relate these two tables to one another, what we need is a third table with all distinct values from both tables. In this tutorial

value.title: Avoid the full refresh with Incremental Refresh in Power BI (Premium)
value.excerpt: Is the full refresh of Incremental Refresh taking a long time? Or, even timing out? Patrick shows you how you can avoid the full refresh and refresh each partition individually when using Power BI Premium!  Handling deletes within Incremental Refresh in Power BI: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nKVrl0ec6uE

Patrick shows you how you can use quick measures, like year over year, with a quick measure and no date table! value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Want to explore locations with data? The Visio visual in Power BI helps you do just that! Patrick looks at how to set it up and help use your data to highlight areas within a Visio diagram.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/visiosample  Documentation: https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-visio-visuals-to-power-bi-reports-4f09be62-f436-45c2-93b0-4a0f66b1f5a7
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZkL2jo3b_5M" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Looking at Power BI Many to Many
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick takes a look at Power BI Many to Many relationships. This was part of the July 2018 Power BI Desktop release and can enable some awesome capabilities. Patrick looks at why you may not want to use Power BI Many to Many even though you think you do.  Many to Many documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-many-to-many-relationships

value.title: Making data source parameters easy in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Patrick shows how you can easily use parameters, for your data source, within Power BI Desktop with minimal clicks. All about reducing the clicks!   Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton --

value.title: Power BI report page tooltip - How to create one in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Patrick walks through what a Power BI report page tooltip is and how to create one in Power BI Desktop. This is a feature that was added to Power BI Desktop in the March 2018 release.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI: Use DAX to get relative dates
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can get relative dates, in Power BI Desktop, without using the relative date slicer or relative date filters. You just need to sprinkle a little DAX into Power BI Desktop to get this going!  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Why you should use DAX Studio with Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you using DAX Studio with Power BI? Patrick shows you why you should consider using it when working with DAX for Power BI!
